text:
Putin bans oil exports to nations that agreed to a western price cap.

President Vladimir Putin announced on Tuesday that his government would ban Russian oil exports to any countries that agreed to the Western price cap put in place earlier this month.

A decree signed by Mr. Putin and released by the Kremlin said that, starting on Feb. 1 and lasting for five months, no Russian oil would be sent to countries that honor the price cap. Read more

@nytimes

Russian Air Base Is Attacked, as Ukraine Discounts Escalation Threat

Ukraine has repeatedly struck military targets in Crimea and other Russian-occupied territories, as well as Russian infrastructure like the Kerch Strait bridge linking Crimea to Russia. Now it is stepping up attacks into Russia itself.

Ukraine launched a drone attack at an air base deep within Russian territory this week, reflecting the assessment by Ukraine’s political and military leaders that the Russian military is already fighting at the limits of its conventional capabilities and the Kremlin’s hints of using nuclear weapons ring hollow. Read more
